name: Grand Hyatt Atlanta in Buckhead

reviews.text: I pricelined my way in to this hotel at just over $80/nite for a weekend stay.
reviews.title: Good value - if you get it through priceline

reviews.text: It's in a pretty good location, though, like most of this part of Buckhead, there is construction all over the place.
reviews.title: Not the Best Pick for Leisure Travelers

reviews.text: Check-in went smoothly - I don't think I was treated any differently as a Priceline customer, though my room was the first one just across from where the lift corridor is. I was expecting this, and didn't complain - nor was noise much of a problem.
reviews.title: It's OK, but it's a bit steep!

reviews.text: Nothing special, the room is just ok even got and upgrade and it was just basic. It should be a 3 and half star not more.
reviews.title: just ok!

reviews.text: I stayed at the Grand Hyatt-Buckhead the last weekend in October 2005. Overall I had a good experience with few compliants. I got it on Priceline for $77/nite + fees for a total of about $185 for two nights. I had a standard king on the 12th floor facing the city.
reviews.title: Good Hotel, Great Location

reviews.text: The exterior and the lobby are beautiful especially at night. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are very nice. The location is ideal for anyone wanting to experience the dining and shopping of Buckhead. Easy access to downtown via car or the subway.
reviews.title: Great Service

aka: Grand Hyatt Atlanta In Buckhead Hotel
description: A tranquil retreat within a vibrant urban setting.
